intro: Arctomecon humilis, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species like the opium poppy. The plant is characterized by its vibrant orange-yellow flowers and delicate, fern-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Arctomecon humilis is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
